alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 06 at 2:07AM MDT until April 06 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...West to southwest winds 45 to 55 MPH with frequent gusts to 75 MPH expected. Blowing snow will also occur over the Snowy Range with whiteout conditions possible at times. * WHERE...Snowy Range and adjacent foothills including Centennial, Arlington, and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight and high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. There will be an extreme risk for vehicle blow overs! Tree and property damage is also possible near the Snowy Range. Mountain recreation may be extremely dangerous to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range
